info.name: Movies WatchList Documentation
info.description:
# ðŸ“„ Get started here

This template contains a boilerplate for documentation that you can quickly customize and reuse.

## ðŸ”– How to use this template

- Replace the content given brackets (()) with your API's details.
- Tips are formatted in `codespan` - feel free to read and remove them.
    

---

`Start with a brief overview of what your API offers.`

The ((product name)) provides many API products, tools, and resources that enable you to ((add product value here)).

`You can also list the APIs you offer, link to the relevant pages, or do both in this section.`

## **Getting started guide**

`List the steps or points required to start using your APIs. Make sure to cover everything required to reach success with your API as quickly as possible.`

To start using the ((add APIs here)), you need to -

`The points given below are from The Postman API's documentation. You can reference it to write your own getting started guide.`

- You must use a valid API Key to send requests to the API endpoints. You can get your API key from Postman's [integrations dashboard](https://go.postman.co/settings/me/api-keys).
- The API has [rate and usage limits](https://learning.postman.com/docs/developer/postman-api/postman-api-rate-limits/).
- The API only responds to HTTPS-secured communications. Any requests sent via HTTP return an HTTP 301 redirect to the corresponding HTTPS resources.
- The API returns request responses in JSON format. When an API request returns an error, it is sent in the JSON response as an error key.
    

## Authentication

`Add details on the authorization keys/tokens required, steps that cover how to get them, and the relevant error codes.`

The ((product name)) API uses ((add your API's authorization type)) for authentication.

`The details given below are from the Postman API's documentation. You can reference it to write your own authentication section.`

Postman uses API keys for authentication. You can generate a Postman API key in the [API keys](https://postman.postman.co/settings/me/api-keys) section of your Postman account settings.

You must include an API key in each request to the Postman API with the X-Api-Key request header.

### Authentication error response

If an API key is missing, malformed, or invalid, you will receive an HTTP 401 Unauthorized response code.

## Rate and usage limits

`Use this section to cover your APIs' terms of use. Include API limits, constraints, and relevant error codes, so consumers understand the permitted API usage and practices.`

`The example given below is from The Postman API's documentation. Use it as a reference to write your APIs' terms of use.`

API access rate limits apply at a per-API key basis in unit time. The limit is 300 requests per minute. Also, depending on your plan, you may have usage limits. If you exceed either limit, your request will return an HTTP 429 Too Many Requests status code.

Each API response returns the following set of headers to help you identify your use status:

| Header | Description |
| --- | --- |
| `X-RateLimit-Limit` | The maximum number of requests that the consumer is permitted to make per minute. |
| `X-RateLimit-Remaining` | The number of requests remaining in the current rate limit window. |
| `X-RateLimit-Reset` | The time at which the current rate limit window resets in UTC epoch seconds. |

### 503 response

An HTTP `503` response from our servers indicates there is an unexpected spike in API access traffic. The server is usually operational within the next five minutes. If the outage persists or you receive any other form of an HTTP `5XX` error, [contact support](https://support.postman.com/hc/en-us/requests/new/).

### **Need some help?**

`Add links that customers can refer to whenever they need help.`

In case you have questions, go through our tutorials ((link to your video or help documentation here)). Or visit our FAQ page ((link to the relevant page)).

Or you can check out our community forum, thereâ€™s a good chance our community has an answer for you. Visit our developer forum ((link to developer forum)) to review topics, ask questions, and learn from others.

`You can also document or add links to libraries, code examples, and other resources needed to make a request.`

item.name: Users

request.description: Gets information about the authenticated user.

item.description:
### Get All Users

The **GET** `/api/users` endpoint returns all registered users in an array.

Response example:

``` json
`
[
    {
        "_id": "67576b3637ba9fd091b3e9e5",
        "name": "John Doe",
        "email": "johndoe@email.com",
        "password": "jai7asMha21",
        "profile": "admin",
        "favoriteMovies": [
            "67576a5daf8cd565e6c078a0"
        ],
        "createdAt": "2024-12-09T22:12:06.377Z",
        "__v": 1
    }
]

 ```

The **POST** `/api/users` endpoint creates a new user. The `id` is automatically generated.

The payload should look like this:

``` json
`
{
    "name": "John Doe",
    "email": "johndoe@email.com",
    "password": "jai7asMha21",
    "profile": "admin",
 }

 ```

The **PUT** `/api/users/:id/favorites` endpoint edit a movie id to the User object.

The payload should look like this:

``` json
`
{
    "movieId": "3434234234234213",
 }

 ```

The **DELETE** `/api/users/:id` endpoint removes a user by id.

Possible responses:

If successful:

``` json
`
{
    "message": "User deleted successfully",
}

 ```

If error:

``` json
`
{
    "message": "Error deleting User",
}

 ```

If id not found:

``` json
`
{
    "message": "User not found",
}

 ```

item.name: Movies

body.raw:
{
    "title": "Transformers 2",
    "synopsis": "Um filme de carros que se transformam",
    "posterPath": "https://google.com",
    "genres": ["action", "race"],
    "duration": "3h",
    "cast": ["Selena Gomez"],
    "streamingPlatforms": ["Netflix", "Disney+"],
    "isWatched": false
}

item.description:
### Get All Movies

The **GET** `/api/movies` endpoint returns all added movies in an array.

Response example:

``` json
`
[
    {
        "_id": "677066d853791666f2cd8406",
        "title": "Transformers 2",
        "synopsis": "Um filme de carros que se transformam",
        "posterPath": "https://google.com",
        "genres": [
            "action",
            "race"
        ],
        "duration": "3h",
        "cast": [
            "Selena Gomez"
        ],
        "streamingPlatforms": [
            "Netflix",
            "Disney+"
        ],
        "isWatched": false,
        "releaseDate": "2024-12-28T21:00:08.928Z",
        "__v": 0
    }
]

 ```

The **POST** `/api/movies` endpoint creates a new movie. The `id` is automatically generated.

The payload should look like this:

``` json
{
    "title": "Transformers 2",
    "synopsis": "Um filme de carros que se transformam",
    "posterPath": "https://google.com",
    "genres": ["action", "race"],
    "duration": "3h",
    "cast": ["Selena Gomez"],
    "streamingPlatforms": ["Netflix", "Disney+"],
    "isWatched": false
}

 ```

The **PUT** `/api/movies/:id` endpoint edit a movie id to the Movie object.

The payload should look like this:

``` json
{
    "posterPath": "https://netflix.com"
}

 ```

The **DELETE** `/api/movies/:id` endpoint removes a movie by id.

Possible responses:

If successful:

``` json
`
{
    "message": "Movie deleted successfully",
}

 ```

If error:

``` json
`
{
    "message": "Error deleting Movie",
}

 ```

If id not found:

``` json
`
{
    "message": "Movie not found",
}

 ```

item.name: Series
Add a review to a serie

item.description:
### Get All Series

The **GET** `/api/series` endpoint returns all added series in an array.

Response example:

``` json
[
    {
        "_id": "6770765953791666f2cd840e",
        "title": "Friends",
        "synopsis": "Uma serie de comedia",
        "posterPath": "assets/series/911.jpg",
        "genres": [
            "comedy",
            "romance"
        ],
        "streamingPlatforms": [
            "netflix",
            "appletv"
        ],
        "cast": [
            "Angelina Jolie"
        ],
        "releaseDate": "2024-12-06T00:00:00.000Z",
        "isWatched": false,
        "imdbRating": 8,
        "seasons": [
            {
                "seasonNumber": 3,
                "episodes": [
                    {
                        "title": "The Pilot",
                        "duration": 40,
                        "synopsis": "Primeiro episodio da temporada",
                        "releaseDate": "2024-12-07T00:00:00.000Z",
                        "_id": "6770765953791666f2cd8410"
                    }
                ],
                "_id": "6770765953791666f2cd840f"
            }
        ],
        "reviews": [],
        "__v": 0
    },
    {
        "_id": "67707c5253791666f2cd8420",
        "title": "Friends",
        "synopsis": "Uma serie de comedia",
        "posterPath": "assets/series/911.jpg",
        "genres": [
            "comedy",
            "romance"
        ],
        "streamingPlatforms": [
            "netflix",
            "appletv"
        ],
        "cast": [
            "Angelina Jolie"
        ],
        "releaseDate": "2024-12-06T00:00:00.000Z",
        "isWatched": false,
        "imdbRating": 8,
        "seasons": [
            {
                "seasonNumber": 3,
                "episodes": [
                    {
                        "title": "The Pilot",
                        "duration": 40,
                        "synopsis": "Primeiro episodio da temporada",
                        "releaseDate": "2024-12-07T00:00:00.000Z",
                        "_id": "67707c5253791666f2cd8422"
                    }
                ],
                "_id": "67707c5253791666f2cd8421"
            }
        ],
        "reviews": [],
        "__v": 0
    }
]

 ```

The **POST** `/api/series` endpoint creates a new serie. The `id` is automatically generated.

Body example:

``` json
{
    "title": "Friends",
    "synopsis": "Uma serie de comedia",
    "posterPath": "assets/series/911.jpg",
    "genres": ["comedy", "romance"],
    "streamingPlatforms": ["netflix", "appletv"],
    "cast": ["Angelina Jolie"],
    "releaseDate": "Dec 6, 2024",
    "isWatched": false,
    "imdbRating": 8,
    "seasons": [{
      "seasonNumber": 3,
      "episodes": [{
        "title": "The Pilot",
        "duration": 40,
        "synopsis": "Primeiro episodio da temporada",
        "releaseDate": "Dec 7, 2024"
      }]
    }]
  }

 ```

The **PUT** `/api/series/:id` endpoint edit a series id to the Series object.

The payload should look like this:

``` json
{
    "posterPath": "assets/series/911.jpg"
}

 ```

The **DELETE** `/api/series/:id` endpoint removes a serie by id.

Possible responses:

If successful:

``` json
`
{
    "message": "Serie deleted successfully",
}

 ```

If error:

``` json
`
{
    "message": "Error deleting Serie",
}

 ```

If id not found:

``` json
`
{
    "message": "Serie not found",
}

 ```

item.name: Reviews
item.description:
### Post add New Review

The **POST** `/api/reviews` adds a new movie review based on an user id.

Body example:

``` json
{
    "movieId": "677066d853791666f2cd8406",
    "userId": "677067f453791666f2cd840b",
    "comment": "Filme sensacional! Recomendo!",
    "rating": 4
}

 ```

The **GET Review by Movie id** `/api/reviews` endpoint returns all user reviews based on a movie id.  
Response example:

``` json
[
    {
        "_id": "677078da53791666f2cd8419",
        "movie": "677066d853791666f2cd8406",
        "user": {
            "_id": "677067f453791666f2cd840b",
            "name": "Maria Doe",
            "email": "mariadoe2@email.com"
        },
        "comment": "Filme sensacional! Recomendo!",
        "rating": 4,
        "createdAt": "2024-12-28T22:16:58.857Z",
        "__v": 0
    }
]

 ```

The **GET review by User id** /api/reviews endpoint returns all reviews made by a user.

Response example:

``` json
[
    {
        "_id": "67707ec953791666f2cd8435",
        "movie": {
            "_id": "677066d853791666f2cd8406",
            "title": "Transformers 2"
        },
        "user": "67707d3353791666f2cd8425",
        "comment": "Filme sensacional! Recomendo!",
        "rating": 4,
        "createdAt": "2024-12-28T22:42:17.246Z",
        "__v": 0
    }
]

 ```

The **DELETE** /api/reviews endpoint removes a review made by users.

Example of a successfully response:

``` json
{
    "message": "Review deleted successfully",
    "deletedReview": {
        "_id": "677078da53791666f2cd8419",
        "movie": "677066d853791666f2cd8406",
        "user": "677067f453791666f2cd840b",
        "comment": "Filme sensacional! Recomendo!",
        "rating": 4,
        "createdAt": "2024-12-28T22:16:58.857Z",
        "__v": 0
    }
}

 ```

**

POST /reviews**

[http://localhost:3001/api/reviews](http://localhost:3001/api/reviews)

**GET /reviews**

By User:

[http://localhost:3001/api/users/:id/reviews](http://localhost:3001/api/users/:id/reviews)

By Movie:

[http://localhost:3001/api/movies/:id/reviews](http://localhost:3001/api/movies/:id/reviews)
